channel.title: School Eshpm on Open Science Community Rotterdam
channel.description: Recent content in School Eshpm on Open Science Community Rotterdam

item.title: OSCR Member: Marianne Tenand
item.description: Description I am a post-doctoral researcher at Erasmus School of Health Policy & Management (ESHPM). My background is in social sciences and applied economics. My current research focuses on the economics aspects of population ageing, in particular on the provision of long-term care services to the elderly. I exploit individual-level data of different types: surveys conducted by Statistical Institutes, administrative register data, or client databases, which I access under confidentially agreements.

item.title: OSCR Member: Meg Perry-Duxbury
item.description: Description My background is applied economics, specifically health economics. My work focuses on opportunity costs in the economic evaluation on health care interventions. I use predominantly pre-collected aggregate data sets, however I also have some experience with Big Data and Survey Data. Iâ€™m fairly new to the Open Science environment, and I am most interested in learning about data management, preregistration and reproducibility. CV and Contact Info Click on the picture to send an email.
